page.title: 14Wildlife in the area ii
page.content: Most deer are poached by lurcher dogs because they are very silent. It is mostly done at night with a spotlight. The time taken to catch a deer is about three minutes. Mr Brown has caught quite a few poachers but it is a very dangerous job. The first lot he caught were fined Â£20 but the carcass cost Â£60. The next lot were fined Â£I000 and got 9 months in jail. Mrs Reynolds told us that the area has a very good bird population. Birds of prey are plenteous. There are lots of kestrels ,buzzards ,merlins and sparrow-hawks as well as owls. On the Downs there is a rare butterfly called the Green Hairstreak. The best butterfly seen here is the Purple Emperor. After spraying a lot of the butterflies left. There are lots of insects, particularly grass- hoppers which live in the ha-ha.
